result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Bloodsaw III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, James E Bloodsaw III was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James E Bloodsaw III is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • James E Bloodsaw III was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • James E Bloodsaw III was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • James E Bloodsaw III was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Each count concur. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: $268 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Make arrangements for child support payments.

timeConds.notes: W/ Huber. Provisions of good time apply. Credit does not apply. Each count concur and consec to 13CF1058.

miscConds.notes: $268 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 5.

Reporter: Lori Gerlach
Attorney L Breun has filed a motion to modify bail. Attorney L Breun puts argument for reduction of bail on the record. ADA R Sattler puts argument on the record opposing any reduction of the defendants bail at this time. Court puts statements on the record regarding the bail motion. Court denies the motion to modify the defendants bail.

Reporter: Lori Gerlach
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days. Attorney L Breun has filed a motion to modify bail. Attorney L Breun puts argument for reduction of bail on the record. ADA R Sattler puts argument on the record opposing any reduction of the defendants bail at this time. Court puts statements on the record regarding the bail motion. Court denies the motion to modify the defendants bail.

Reporter: Lori Gerlach
Exhibit #1 marked. Det. Peter G duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA R Sattler. Witness identified defendant. Direct exam by ADA R. Sattler continued. State moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. Defense has no objection. Court admits Exhibit #1. Direct exam by ADA R. Sattler continued. Cross exam by Atty L Breun. State moves for bindover waives argument. Defense opposes bindover defendant interrupts court - defendants wants to make a record - he has been advised by counsel and by the court that everything will be put on the record. Defendant is still wanting to make a record. Defendants puts questions and statements on the record regardless of consequences. Atty L Breun moves to withdraw as counsel since the defendant is proceeding on a pro-se basis at this point. Defendant continues to ask questions, court continually answers questions to no avail. Defense opposes bindover puts argument on the record. State puts rebuttal argument in favor of bindover on the record. Court makes probable cause finding. Court makes finding that a felony was committed and that the defendant probably committed it. Court binds case over to Branch 12. Attorney L Breun has filed a motion to modify bail. Attorney L Breun puts argument for reduction of bail on the record. ADA R Sattler puts argument on the record opposing any reduction of the defendants bail at this time. Court puts statements on the record regarding the bail motion. Court denies the motion to modify the defendants bail.
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Julius E and/or Makayla S.
- Defendant shall not use or possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Julius E and/or Makayla S.
- Defendant shall not use or possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
